title: Figure, 1769–70
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description:
a) "Asia" standing female figure, wearing turban and holding pieces of cinnamon and an elephant tusk; attended by seated, turbaned putto, holding censer and horse-tail sceptre; square pedestal.
b) "Europe" standing female figure, wearing erine and crown, holding goose pen and sceptre; attended by putto, leaning on globe; attributes: book and sword; square pedestal.
c) " Africa" standing male figure, black, wearing tunic with feather belt and collar, and feather headdress, and holding bow: attended by monkey, holding quiver with arrows; square pedestal. 
d) " America" standing male figure, wearing feather belt, long cape and headdress, holding sceptre and parrot; attributes: crocodile and cornucopia. Square pedestal.

tombstone.epitaph:
Figure, 1769–70.
1769–70. Porcelain, polychrome and gilt. Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde. 1960-1-44-f.
